name: opencbm
description: Provides access to various floppy drive formats

repo.name: OpenCBM
repo.description: Win NT/7/8/10/11, Linux/i386/AMD64 and FreeBSD kernel driver and development library to control serial CBM devices, such as the Commodore 1541 disk drive, connected to the PC's parallel port via a XM1541 or XA1541 cable. Fast disk copier included. Successor of cbm4linux. Also supports the XU1541 and the XUM1541 devices (a.k.a. "ZoomFloppy").

readme.summary: Good conceptual overview but completely lacks practical usage instructions, directing users to external documentation instead.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions, quick start guide, or usage examples in the README - all deferred to external website

security.summary: The code appears to be relatively secure, but lacks input validation and error handling mechanisms that could potentially lead to security issues.

common_complaints: Compilation failures with modern toolchains (gcc C23 standard, missing headers)
Build issues on newer platforms (Raspberry Pi OS, macOS Sonoma)
Hardware compatibility and detection problems (1581, 8050/8250 misidentification)
Feature gaps (d82copy drive selection, d80 track identification)
Stale releases and lack of version updates
praise_themes: Active community members contributing patches and workarounds
Ongoing development efforts (RP2040/TinyUSB variant in progress)
Long-term project with historical success and dedicated users
sentiment.summary: OpenCBM shows moderate community health with engaged users reporting issues and active development, but faces mounting technical debt from compatibility with modern compilers and platforms that require maintainer attention.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and patient. They provide technical depth and encourage new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-12-11)
50 open issues with no resolution activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: The opencbm project shows clear signs of abandonment with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a recent commit timestamp, suggesting the repository may be dormant or the timestamp data is unreliable.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is detailed but lacks clear installation instructions and a quick start guide, making it difficult for new users to get started.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear installation instructions and a quick start example
Community: compilation issues with newer compilers and OS versions
highlights: Recent commits in the past six months
Multiple contributors active in the last six months
At least one merged PR in the last six months
